subject: Learning
title: MOOCs: University for Everyone?
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on MOOCs: University for Everyone?.

hook.text: In 2012, a Stanford professor put his AI course online. 160,000 students from 190 countries enrolled.

buildup.text: Massive Open Online Courses promised to democratize elite education for free.

discovery.text: Platforms like Coursera and edX offered Harvard and MIT courses to anyone with internet access.

twist.text: Completion rates hovered around 5â€“10%. Access didn't equal engagement or achievement.

climax.text: MOOCs evolved into paid certificates and micro-credentials. The free revolution became a business.

punchline.text: MOOCs opened the door. Few walked all the way through.

quiz.question: What was the main challenge faced by MOOCs?
options: Very low completion rates despite high enrollment
